HugsLib.UpdateFeatureDef.content: You've been recruited to test this out! |This is a work in progress, and we're thrilled you are giving it a shot! Bear in mind you might encounter some errors and incompatibilities. If you do, please let me know. Don't forget to hit Ctrl+F12 to upload the error log and send me that link. I'm also open to any suggestions you might have, so please keep in touch! | |Here's a quick guide to get you started: |img:TechButton |Check out the new tab for your colonists. It displays the sum of their knowledge, and that represents the limit of what they are able to build, repair, craft, grow and also the weapons they are able to equip. A starting knowledge set is generated for every pawn based on background, age and faction. From there, its your task to educate them! | |img:Study+Shelf |Build a study desk and a bookshelf as soon as you can. This allows your colonists to document their knowledge into books and then study books to acquire new knowledge (when assigned to study). | |img:ResearchBenches |These are the new, more compact research benches. Their function hasn't changed, but you'll assign research projects individually to each colonist and what they learn will remain only in their heads until they can write a book on their discoveries. Only when that book is archived on a bookshelf you will really have unlocked that technology. | |img:Target+Dummy |When you discover new weapons, your colonists will need to train at these facilities in order to learn how to use them (for that, they must also be assigned to study). The training dummy is for meleee weapons and the target stand is for ranged ones. You can also task them with practicing a weapon. This will allow them to sharpen their melee or shooting skills! | |img:Quarantine|caption:Please, consider supporting the making of this mod! This is being made as I try to mantain myself as isolated as possible during the COVID-19 crisis. Like many people around the world, my living has been impacted by the global efforts to contain the pandemic, and this is my effort to remain productive. If you are able to contribute, you can buy me a coffee on https://ko-fi.com/jptrrs, or follow the link above. Many, many thanks for your support!

Friendly Update (IMPORTANT!) |The feedback you gave us on this first testing round has provided very valuable insights on how to improve Human Resources. Beyond the usual fixes and compatibility patches, this update adresses some issues to try and make it more intuitive and give you the player better information. These are the main changes. If you're in the middle of a game you started before the update, there are some changes you should be aware of. (Also, in that case, if you get any errors, please try deleting any current bills on research and study benches.) |1. The Learn work type has been renamed to Study. |2. The document technology task you assign your colonists to write books down now also belongs to the study work type, since that's made at the study desk. ;-) |3. It used to be possible for a pawn to learn a new weapon only if the corresponding technology book was already stored in one of your bookshelves. Now, if the pawn already knows that technolgy personally, he or she will also be able to train with that weapon. To allow for this, the weapons list on the recipe window no longer hides the weapons your colony can't access. Therefore, keep in mind there will be weapons you can check but your pawns won't necessarily be able to learn. |4. The Tech tab has gained some new capabilities. Check the new controls!|img:newButtons |5. The speed for the research and study tasks now scales with the difficulty level selected for your game, slowing down on higher levels (on top of the difficulty scaling the base game already applies to the research task). This means researching with Human Resources will be even more difficult on higher difficulty levels. You can turn that off, if you wish, on the mod options menu. |Check the full change notes on our Steam page. | |Please, consider supporting the making of this mod! If you are able to contribute, you can buy me a coffee on https://ko-fi.com/jptrrs, or follow the link above. Many, many thanks!

Easy Homework Update (IMPORTANT!) |Following your feedback, we've made important changes to the way you select technologies for your colonists to study, document and research. The days of picking techs on the bills ingredient filter are over! Instead, now you do it... |A) On the Tech tab itself, simply by clicking on the desired technology. |img:HomeworkIndicator|caption:If the pawn knows it but its not on your library yet, it will be marked to be documented. If he doesn't know it but it's available, it will be marked for studying. |B) On the main Research Tab, by clicking on the the desired tech and selecting the pawn on a pop-up menu. |img:HomeworkOnTree|caption:This will set the techs to be researched or studied, depending on their availability. A picture of your colonist will be displayed on that tech, so it will be much easier to plan his path. |The game will automatically assign any other pre-requisites that might be necessary, so no more hassle trying to figure this out! By the way: now a pawn can forego learning a pre-requisite tech if he already knows its descendants. (No need to go all the way back to Smithing in order to research Machining if you're already an expert Gunsmith!) |Those changes mean we don't need the bills on the Research Benches anymore. But they remain on the Study Desk, where you must still assign study and documenting jobs. |Check the full change notes on our Steam page. |Please, consider supporting the making of this mod! If you are able to contribute, you can buy me a coffee on https://ko-fi.com/jptrrs, or follow the link above. Many, many thanks!
